Grumpy Gits SG

The monthly user group that doesn't lose your data!

May 20, 2015

Git Meetup 0.2.0

It's time for the second meetup!

This meetup is aimed at both beginners and people who have over 10 years of Git experience (wait a minute...). We hope to stretch your Gitability level, and better your understanding of version control systems!

Programme

  • Debugging with Git - Ryan Dao

    Git is more than just a version control system. It's also one of the best debugging tools if used correctly. In this talk I'm going to show how Git and Delta Debugging can be used to help identify issues in your codebase.

  • Interactive rebasing with Git - Jason Chionh

    In this short talk, we'll go through the command "git rebase -i". This is git rebasing in interactive mode. You can use it to organize local commit history. Specifically, we'll look at squashing many commits into one commit and re-ordering commits.

  • Lightning talk: Stashing, yo! - Angelo Rohit
  • Lightning talk: Pull request, yo! - Lian Hau Lee

Come merge with your fellow Gits!

Interested in speaking?

Please get in touch with Sahil, Valentine or ChernJie. We're looking for lightning talks!

Request for Presenters

Would you like to speak at an upcoming meetup? We're looking for speakers on -

  • How you got over the initial Git learning curve
  • Using Git to track data other than code
  • Your favorite but lesser-known Git utility
  • When to modify history for fun and profit
  • Your newest crazy idea using Git
  • How to stash effectively
  • Demystifying git rebase
  • Case studies of unique repos, e.g. the Linux kernel
  • Interesting Git workflows
  • How your community uses Git
  • Git CSI (archaeology/investigation)
  • GitHub alternatives
  • Git hooks

If you're interested in speaking, please get in touch on Gitter or Facebook chat!
